intro: Ortholoma illepidum, commonly known as the narrowleaf ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Ortholoma illepidum is often found in the coastal and inland regions of southern California.
